entry.name: AllJoyn Router Service
entry.description: Routes AllJoyn messages for the local AllJoyn clients.

entry.name: Application Layer Gateway Service
entry.description: Provides support for 3rd party protocol plug-ins for Internet Connection Sharing.

entry.name: Bluetooth Support Service
entry.description: The Bluetooth service supports discovery and association of remote Bluetooth devices.

entry.name: Computer Browser
entry.description: Maintains an updated list of computers on the network and supplies this list to computers designated as browsers.

entry.name: Connected User Experiences and Telemetry
entry.description: The Connected User Experiences and Telemetry service enables features that support in-application and connected user experiences. Additionally, this service manages the event driven collection and transmission of diagnostic and usage information (used to improve the experience and quality of the Windows Platform) when the diagnostics and usage privacy option settings are enabled under Feedback and Diagnostics.

entry.name: Diagnostic Policy Service
entry.description: The Diagnostic Policy Service enables problem detection, troubleshooting and resolution for Windows components.

entry.name: Diagnostic Service Host
entry.description: The Diagnostic Service Host is used by the Diagnostic Policy Service to host diagnostics that need to run in a Local Service context.

entry.name: Diagnostic System Host
entry.description: The Diagnostic System Host is used by the Diagnostic Policy Service to host diagnostics that need to run in a Local System context.

entry.name: Downloaded Maps Manager
entry.description: Windows service for application access to downloaded maps. This service is started on-demand by application accessing downloaded maps.

entry.name: Encrypting File System (EFS)
entry.description: Provides the core file encryption technology used to store encrypted files on NTFS file system volumes.

entry.name: Function Discovery Provider Host
entry.description: The FDPHOST service hosts the Function Discovery (FD) network discovery providers. These FD providers supply network discovery services for the Simple Services Discovery Protocol (SSDP) and Web Services â€“ Discovery (WS-D) protocol. Stopping or disabling the FDPHOST service will disable network discovery for these protocols when using FD. When this service is unavailable, network services using FD and relying on these discovery protocols will be unable to find network devices or resources.

entry.name: Function Discovery Resource Publication
entry.description: Publishes this computer and resources attached to this computer so they can be discovered over the network.

entry.name: Interactive Services Detection
entry.description: Enables user notification of user input for interactive services, which enables access to dialogs created by interactive services when they appear. If this service is stopped, notifications of new interactive service dialogs will no longer function and there might not be access to interactive service dialogs.

entry.name: Internet Connection Sharing (ICS)
entry.description: Provides network address translation, addressing, name resolution and/or intrusion prevention services for a home or small office network.

entry.name: Offline Files
entry.description: The Offline Files service performs maintenance activities on the Offline Files cache, responds to user logon and logoff events, implements the internals of the public API, and dispatches interesting events to those interested in Offline Files activities and changes in cache state.

entry.name: Optimize drives
entry.description: Helps the computer run more efficiently by optimizing files on storage drives.

entry.name: Secure Socket Tunneling Protocol Service
entry.description: Provides support for the Secure Socket Tunneling Protocol (SSTP) to connect to remote computers using VPN.

entry.name: Sensor Monitoring Service
entry.description: Monitors various sensors in order to expose data and adapt to system and user state.

entry.name: Shell Hardware Detection
entry.description: Provides notifications for AutoPlay hardware events.

entry.name: SSDP Discovery
entry.description: Discovers networked devices and services that use the SSDP discovery protocol, such as UPnP devices. Also announces SSDP devices and services running on the local computer.

entry.name: UPnP Device Host
entry.description: Allows UPnP devices to be hosted on this computer.

entry.name: Windows Mobile Hotspot Service
entry.description: Provides the ability to share a cellular data connection with another device. Recommended by Microsoft to disable: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/remote/remote-desktop-services/rds-vdi-recommendations

entry.name: Windows Update
entry.description: Enables the detection, download, and installation of updates for Windows and other programs.

entry.name: Xbox Live Auth Manager
entry.description: Provides authentication and authorization services for interacting with Xbox Live.

entry.name: Xbox Live Game Save
entry.description: This service syncs save data for Xbox Live save enabled games.

group.description: Disable all 32 and 64-bit Active Setup items to prevent them from running at first user logon.

entry.name: Disable Active Setup (32-bit)
entry.description: Disable all 32-bit Active Setup items to prevent them from running at first user logon. All Active Setup items are disable by renaming the registry key "HKLM\SOFTWARE\WOW6432Node\Microsoft\Active Setup\Installed Components". The key "Installed Components" will be renamed to "_DISABLED Installed Components_%Date%_%Time%". For example: "_DISABLED Installed Components_2018-10-31_02-42-10". Does not support rollback.

entry.name: Disable Active Setup (64-bit)
entry.description: Disable all 64-bit Active Setup items to prevent them from running at first user logon. All Active Setup items are disable by renaming the registry key "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Active Setup\Installed Components". The key "Installed Components" will be renamed to "_DISABLED Installed Components_%Date%_%Time%". For example: "_DISABLED Installed Components_2018-10-31_02-42-10". Does not support rollback.

group.description: Disable additional services besides the ones included in the Citrix Optimizer.

entry.name: App Readiness
entry.description: Gets apps ready for use the first time a user signs in to this PC and when adding new apps. This service causes black screen issues on Windows Server 2016. Disabling this service may cause an issue with Windows Update (if so, when updating the image, enable this service again).

entry.name: Device Setup Manager
entry.description: Enables the detection, download and installation of device-related software. If this service is disabled, devices may be configured with outdated software, and may not work correctly.

entry.name: dmwappushsvc
entry.description: WAP Push Message Routing Service.

entry.name: Network Connection Broker
entry.description: Brokers connections that allow Microsoft Store Apps to receive notifications from the internet.

entry.name: Program Compatibility Assistant Service
entry.description: This service provides support for the Program Compatibility Assistant (PCA). PCA monitors programs installed and run by the user and detects known compatibility problems. If this service is stopped, PCA will not function properly.

entry.name: Quality Windows Audio Video Experience
entry.description: Quality Windows Audio Video Experience (qWave) is a networking platform for Audio Video (AV) streaming applications on IP home networks. qWave enhances AV streaming performance and reliability by ensuring network quality-of-service (QoS) for AV applications. It provides mechanisms for admission control, run time monitoring and enforcement, application feedback, and traffic prioritization.

entry.name: Radio Management Service
entry.description: Radio Management and Airplane Mode Service.

entry.name: Sensor Data Service
entry.description: Delivers data from a variety of sensors.

entry.name: Sensor Service
entry.description: A service for sensors that manages different sensors' functionality. Manages Simple Device Orientation (SDO) and History for sensors. Loads the SDO sensor that reports device orientation changes. If this service is stopped or disabled, the SDO sensor will not be loaded and so auto-rotation will not occur. History collection from Sensors will also be stopped.

entry.name: WalletService
entry.description: Hosts objects used by clients of the wallet.

entry.name: Windows Error Reporting Service
entry.description: Allows errors to be reported when programs stop working or responding and allows existing solutions to be delivered. Also allows logs to be generated for diagnostic and repair services. If this service is stopped, error reporting might not work correctly and results of diagnostic services and repairs might not be displayed.

entry.name: Windows Insider Service
entry.description: Provides infrastructure support for the Windows Insider Program. This service must remain enabled for the Windows Insider Program to work.

entry.name: Disable System Recovery
entry.description: Disable System Recovery recommended by Citrix (https://support.citrix.com/article/CTX216252) using the command "bcdedit.exe /set recoveryenabled no". Does not support rollback.

params.value: # Retrieve the current configuration of System Recovery. [string]$BCDValue = bcdedit.exe '/enum' '{default}' [array]$BCDArray = $BCDValue.Split(" ",[System.StringSplitOptions]::RemoveEmptyEntries) [string]$BCDResult = ($BCDArray[$BCDArray.IndexOf("recoveryenabled")+1]).Trim() if ( $BCDResult -eq "No" ) { $Global:CTXOE_Result = $True } else { $Global:CTXOE_Result = $False } if ( $BCDResult -eq "No" ) { $Global:CTXOE_Details = "System Recovery is optimized (= disabled). Current value: $BCDResult. Rollback is currently not supported." } else { $Global:CTXOE_Details = "System Recovery is NOT optimized (= enabled). Current value: $BCDResult. Rollback is currently not supported." } Return

entry.name: Native Image Generation (NGEN.exe) 32-bit
entry.description: THIS IS SLOW, it's normal for this operation to take a long time (about 2 minutes on a clean Windows Server 2016 version 1607). This optimization pre-compiles .NET assemblies instead of using the just-in-time compilation using NGEN.exe. Does not support analyze/rollback modes, but it is generally safe to use. Note: the status of this setting is always displayed as "optimized" within Citrix Opimizer. Please ignore this status and always execute this item when sealing your image.
